Group: These settings affect all members in your community.
Circle: These settings affect all members in your community.
These settings are applied on a per member level basis. Start by selecting the member level you want to modify, then adjust the settings for that level below.
Do you want to let users view circles? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply.

Group: No, do not allow groups to be viewed.
Circle: No, do not allow circles to be viewed.

Group: Yes, allow viewing and subscription of groups.
Circle: Yes, allow viewing and subscription of circles.

Group: Yes, allow members to view all groups, even private ones.
Circle: Yes, allow members to view all circles, even private ones.

Do you want to let users create circles? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply. This is useful if you want users to be able to view circles and manage their subscriptions, but only want certain levels to be able to create circles.

Group: No, do not allow groups to be created.
Circle: No, do not allow circles to be created.

Group: Do you want to let users edit and delete groups?
Circle: Do you want to let users edit and delete circles?

Group: No, do not allow groups to be edited.
Circle: No, do not allow circles to be edited.

Group: Yes, allow  members to edit their own groups.
Circle: Yes, allow  members to edit their own circles.

Group: Yes, allow members to edit everyone's groups.
Circle: Yes, allow members to edit everyone's circles.

Your users can choose from any of the options checked below when they decide who can see their circle. If you do not check any options, settings will default to the last saved configuration. If you select only one option, members of this level will not have a choice.

Your users can choose from any of the options checked below when they decide who can post to their circle discussions. If you do not check any options, settings will default to the last saved configuration. If you select only one option, members of this level will not have a choice.

Your users can choose from any of the options checked below when they decide who can upload photos to their circles. If you do not check any options, settings will default to the last saved configuration. If you select only one option, members of this level will not have a choice.

Your users can choose from any of the options checked below when they decide who can create events in their circles. If you do not check any options, settings will default to the last saved configuration. If you select only one option, members of this level will not have a choice.

Group: Are you sure that you want to delete this group? It will not be recoverable after being deleted.
Circle: Are you sure that you want to delete this circle? It will not be recoverable after being deleted.

Group: Are you sure you want to delete the selected groups?
Circle: Are you sure you want to delete the selected circles?

This page lists all of the circle entries your users have posted. You can use this page to monitor these circles and delete offensive material if necessary. Entering criteria into the filter fields will help you find specific circle entries. Leaving the filter fields blank will show all the circle entries on your social network.

If you want to allow your users to categorize their circles, create the categories below. This feature is useful if you want to list all your users' circle that If you have no categories, your users will not be given the option of assigning a circle category.

Group: Are you sure that you want to delete this category? It will not be recoverable after being deleted.
Do you want to let members delete groups? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply.
Circle: Do you want to let members delete circles? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply.

Group: Yes, allow members to delete their own groups.
Circle: Yes, allow members to delete their own circles.

Group: No, do not allow members to delete their groups.
Circle: No, do not allow members to delete their circles.

Group: Do you want to let members of this level comment on groups?
Circle: Do you want to let members of this level comment on circles?

Group: Yes, allow members to comment on groups.
Circle: Yes, allow members to comment on circles.

Group: No, do not allow members to comment on groups.
Circle: No, do not allow members to comment on circles.

If you have disabled HTML in posts but want to allow specific tags, you can enter them below (separated by commas). If you have enabled HTML in posts, this setting will have no effect.  Example: b, img, a, embed, font

Group: Yes, members can use BBCode tags.
Circle: Yes, members can use BBCode tags.

Group: No, do not let members use BBCode.
Circle: No, do not let members use BBCode.

Group: Yes, members can use HTML in their posts.
Circle: Yes, members can use HTML in their posts.

Circle: {item:$subject} has been made an officer for the circle {item:$object}

Circle: {item:$subject} replied to a {item:$object:topic} in the circle {itemParent:$object:group}: {body:$body}

Circle: {item:$subject} has {item:$object:posted} on a {itemParent:$object::group topic} you posted on.

Circle: {item:$subject} has invited you to the circle {item:$object}.

Circle: {item:$subject} has requested to join the circle {item:$object}.

Circle: Your request to join the circle {item:$subject} has been approved.

Circle: You were promoted to officer in the circle {item:$object}.
This email is sent to the member when they are approved to join a circle.
You have been approved to join the circle [object_title]

[header]

You have been approved to join the circle "[object_title]". Please click the following link to view it:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
This email is sent to the member when someone requests to join their circle.
[sender_title] has requested to join the circle [object_title]

[header]

[sender_title] has requested to join the circle "[object_title]". Please click the following link to view it:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
This email is sent to the member when people reply to discussion topics that the member created.
A member has posted a reply to your topic "[object_title]" in the circle "[object_parent_title]"

[header]

[sender_title] has posted a reply to your topic "[object_title]" in the circle "[object_parent_title]":

"[message]"

Please click the following link to view it:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
This email is sent to the member when people reply to discussion topics that the member replied to.
A member has posted a reply to the topic "[object_title]" you replied to in the circle "[object_parent_title]"

[header]

[sender_title] has posted a reply to the topic "[object_title]" you replied to in the circle "[object_parent_title]":

"[message]"

Please click the following link to view it:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
This email is sent to the member when they are invited to a circle.
You have been invited to join the circle [object_title]

[header]

You have been invited to join the circle "[object_title]". Please click the following link to view it:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
This email is sent when a member is promoted to officer in a circle.
You have been promoted to officer in the circle [object_title]

[header]

You have been promoted to officer in the circle "[object_title]". Please click the following link to view it:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
